intro: Sericola, commonly known as the "glasswort," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Amaranthaceae. These plants are typically found in saline or coastal environments, where they thrive in high-salinity soils. Sericola species are characterized by their succulent, fleshy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. They often have a creeping or prostrate growth habit, which helps them survive in harsh, windy conditions. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in traditional medicine or as ornamental plants.
